page.title: 14A DAY IN ROSIE'S LIFE
page.content: At seven thirty I crawled out of bed to get ready for school, then realised it was Saturday. So I went to watch TV AM. At eight my dad came downstairs to cook breakfast. He doesn't like the TV on before nine- so breakfast instead. At eleven I was dragged from the screen to go riding at Buxton. When we got there we paid the fee and sorted out riding hats to fit. The horse I had was 'Freckles'. Sharon led the horses into the riding area where we started walking the horses round and round. We started to trot, then trotting without stirrups. I fell into the mud and water below. Home after the lesson meant watching Grandstand on the TV. I made tea, watched some more telly then at ten dragged myself to bed.
